assistantContext: My name is Alex. I work as a software developer focused on backend systems and distributed services. I enjoy building reliable systems, reading about software architecture, and maintaining a disciplined but sustainable routine. Lately I feel mentally scattered due to context switching and want to regain consistency and focus in my daily work.

testData.What habit, routine or area of your life: I want to improve my ability to focus deeply on complex tasks without constant distractions.
testData.Why is it important for you to work on t: Sustained focus is critical for my professional growth as a software developer. In the long term, I want to produce higher-quality work and feel more in control of my time.
testData.Have you already tried to build or maint: I tried time blocking and pomodoro techniques. They helped initially, but I often abandoned them when deadlines or unexpected tasks appeared.
testData.How would you like to approach the proce: I prefer a structured but realistic approach that adapts to my workload instead of a rigid plan that breaks under pressure.
testData.Which approach suits you best: progressi: Progressive and smooth. I value consistency over intensity.
testData.Do you have any environment, person or p: Working early in the morning in a quiet environment helps me stay focused, especially before meetings and messages start.
testData.What thought or emotion usually makes yo: Frustration when I feel I am not being productive enough, which leads me to abandon the routine altogether.
